characters: A STICK OF DHARMA INITIATIVE SALAMI. WIDEN TO
INTO THE SIDE OF HER FUCKING HEAD
TURNS TO LOOK TOWARD THE ARMORY DOOR --
WATCH IT. AND JACK IS FUCKING YELLING NOW --
WE SMASH RIGHT BACK IN ON
FUCKING SAWYER HEADING INTO THAT BAR
AND AS ANA LUCIA RAISES HER GUN, POINTS IT RIGHT AT HENRY
SUDDENLY A COMMOTION CAN BE HEARD FROM THE HALLWAY
WE STAY IN THE CAR WITH ANA LUCIA, WINDSHIELD WIPERS GOIN
HIS TIED HANDS UP _AND SMASHES THE PORCELAIN FOOD BOWL RI
SHOCKED. HOLDING THE BLANKETS SHE WAS GETTING FOR HER PIC

dialogues.speaker: WE SMASH RIGHT BACK IN ON
dialogues.text: In the flesh and looking like death warmed over. He lies unconscious on the JUNGLE FLOOR as a concerned KATE illuminates his battered and scraggly face with a TORCH -

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Michael. Michael. No response -- his eyes stay closed, his condition worsen by the second. Kate looks to JACK.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with him? But Jack’s attention is on the TREELINE. His mind’s been racing since the moment Michael appeared, FULLY AMPED. He SCANS for signs of movement. Reaches for his GUN -- not about to be satisfied until he gets what he came here for QUALITY FACE TIME WITH THE OTHERS. Kate’s totally focused on Michael --

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jack! But Jack’s still looking out at the jungle --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Maybe they let him go...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let him go? -- he’s alone...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We don’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I know he’s sick -- and I know he’s been gone two weeks -- stop looking for (fucking) them!! Jack turns, looks at her. Kate’s still pissed, but she’s focused on Michael’s UNCONSCIOUS FORM as -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They didn’t just push him out of the jungle, Jack -- And as much as Jack’d like to get down to business with t Others right now, as much as he hates being turned around again? HE KNOWS KATE’S RIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: KATE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -- He’s alone! Jack holsters his gun, walks back over to them. Kate scuffles aside as Jack leans over Michael, checks hi pulse -- his BREATH. A beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: C’mon, let’s go. And YEAH -- we did detect a hint of DEFEAT in Jack’s voic there. But he’s already throwing Michael over his shoulde in a fireman's carry and WALKING OFF. And OFF KATE as after a beat, she FOLLOWS --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark. The sparse lights lend a MOODY, almost CREEPY GLOW. FIND ANA LUCIA. Chopping a MANGO and putting it ina bowl. As she licks the juice off her fingers, she glances into the bedroom to see: LOCKE. Asleep. Lying on his side of the bottom bunk, his back to her. His crutches leaning up beside the bed. She turns away, grabs the bowl and heads to --

dialogues.speaker: THE ARMORY DOOR SLIDES OPEN.
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia enters, carrying in the BOWL of FRUIT, looking HENRY. He’s exhausted, weak, BEATEN. He sits on his COT, hands tied together in front of him, feet bound, staring blankly at the wall. This is a man who has clearly GIVEN A bowl of NOW OLD FRUIT sits a few feet from him.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Hey, Henry, whad’dya say? (no response) Just the usual nothing, huh? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points to the bowl) How long you gonna keep up the hunger strike, man? A SILENT BEAT. NOTHING FROM HENRY. Not even a FLICKER fro his eyes. Ana Lucia decides to do the talking -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) I ever tell you I was a cop? (no response) Y’‘know, I’ve been around a lot of killers. (Henry remains silent) And you know what surprises me about ‘em? How much they like to talk. Ana Lucia goes to take the bowl of old fruit, replacing i with the fresh mangoes -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) (looks at him) But I guess you’re different, huh, Henry? Quiet. (beat) Well don’t tell anyone, but that’s just the way I like you. And then -- Henry MUMBLES something. It’s barely audible, but it’s the first sound he’s made in days. Ana stops wit the fruit. Looks at him -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) What was that? Henry MUMBLES again. Ana Lucia LEANS IN closer -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) If you’re gonna say something, you're gonna have to -- And before she can fucking process anything, Henry’s SWIN

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE SIDE OF HER FUCKING HEAD
dialogues.text: SMAAASSSHHH. CRAAACCKK. Porcelain pieces shatter and halo off her HAIRLINE. Ana Lucia falls back, stunned. Henry’s eyes are fierce as seizes the moment and lunges toward her, GRABBING her NEC between his bare hands -- That’s right. HE’S GONNA STRANGLE HER. HIS HISSES, INTENS (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You make me sick. Ana’s eyes go WIDE -- she tries to fight back, but she’s dazed from the blow and lack of oxygen -- Henry knows he’ got the advantage. And despite what he’s doing, he is ODD CALM. And that? Is fucking DISTURBING -- HENRY (CONT’D) You killed two of us. Good people who were leaving you alone and you murdered them. Ana Lucia knows this is going bad. She gathers her remain strength, and KNEES HENRY right in the GROIN. And you kno what? It doesn’t stop him for a second. His grip TIGHTENS on her NECK and he SLAMS HER UP AGAINST THE WALL. And as her head BANGS against the CONCRETE it hits her al once: she’s going to fucking DIE here -- HENRY (CONT’D) You're the killer, Ana Lucia. You're the killer. Ana Lucia teeters on the brink of consciousness, her body beginning to go limp when -- THWACK! Henry collapses in a heap. AS HE FALLS, WE -- RACK FOCUS AND FIND -- LOCKE. Holding the CRUTCH he used to SMASH HENRY OVER THE HEAD. looks to Ana Lucia, GASPING FOR AIR --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Guess he decided to start talking, huh? OFF ANA LUCIA as she looks to a now unconscious HENRY -- as shook up by the fact that he just tried to KILL her... As _ by what he fucking SAID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROOFTOP GARAGE full of LAPD CARS with an impressive vie the LA skyline. An LAPD SQUAD CAR pulls up. Ana Lucia gets out, heads for the station entrance.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You look tired. That’s when she sees her CAPTAIN, TERESA CORTEZ, waiting her. And Captain Cortez? She also happens to be Ana Lucia MOTHER. Ana is instantly awkward, but cracks a wise-ass smile to cover --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks. Cortez doesn’t smile. Just studies her daughter -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) What?

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Where were you last night? Ana Lucia makes a calculated effort not to make eye conta

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: All night?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I made myself some dinner, watched TV. Exciting.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: What’d you watch?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Some reality show.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Which -- ? -- A stupid one. ON CORTEZ. She’s had enough. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Look at me, Ana. And Ana Lucia DOES look at her. A long beat as Cortez studies her. Not like a mother... but like a COP. Then -- CORTEZ (CONT’D) Let’s go for a drive. That wasn’t a request. It was an ORDER. And OFF ANA LUCIA

dialogues.speaker: SCHTHUNK
dialogues.text: STAINLESS STEEL DOOR IS PULLED OPEN and A METAL SLAB IS PULLED OUT OF THE DRAWER. On it -- A SHEET COVERING WHAT IS CLEARLY A DEAD BODY. Yeah. We’re in_a fucking MORGUE. Cortez stands over the body, Ana Lucia right next to her. Intentionally AVERTS her eyes as Cortez pulls back the sh The DEAD GUY is a young, white man. His CHEST is riddled with GUNSHOT WOUNDS. If you’re a loyal viewer, you recogn this guy as JASON -- the man Ana Lucia shot in “Collision If you’re NOT, Cortez is about to explain it to you...

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Found him in a parking lot just after three in the morning. He was dead an hour before anyone saw him. ON ANA LUCIA. She blinks. Maybe a shred of... GUILT? CORTEZ (CONT’D) Crime scene pulled the gun from a dumpster. Registration filed off. No prints. No witnesses. (beat) He was executed. Ana finally looks up to see her mother looking right at h And it’s with a completely STRAIGHT FACE that she says --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Any idea who did it? A beat. Another beat. Cortez’s eyes UNBLINKING. Finally -

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Yeah, Ana. You did it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia opens her mouth to protest, but before she can CORTEZ (CONT’D) This man -- he confesses to shooting you in cold blood. But you? You refuse to ID him. So we have to cut him loose. (pointed) And a week later, he turns up with five bullets in his chest because somebody shot him. In cold blood. And that IS guilt on Ana Lucia’s face. And her eyes are starting to water. But she fucking CHOKES it down --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Guess I better get a lawyer. And Ana turns to go, but -- Cortez grabs her by the wrist. PULLS her around. And we c see that there is MUCH more than anger here -- this is a mother who is DEEPLY FUCKING WORRIED about her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Look, you and I both know this is a dead end investigation. (beat; emotional) But if you... If you did this, I have to help you, Ana. I just --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks. (pulls away; then) But I’m fine. But Cortez isn’t giving up. Really REACHING OUT here --

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: You won’t let me help you? Then you’re gonna need to get it from somewhere else. (beat; measured) You’re a police officer, Ana. If you don’t respect me, respect that. A TENSE BEAT, as Ana Lucia’s eyes fill with emotion. We c see that part of her WANTS to ask for help. WANTS to collapse into her mother’s arms and apologize. WANTS to t her what this man -- what this FUCKER -- really did to he (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Ana? She can’t do any of that. So without a word, she removes her BADGE. UNHOLSTERS her gun. And hands them bot to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I quit. AND OFF ANA LUCIA as she throws open the door and begins will be a LONG WALK away from everything she’s ever known

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia stands in front of the mirror. She’s pulled her hair back to reveal the BLOODY WOUND RIGHT ABOVE HER EAR. She WINCES in pain as she dabs it with a WET TOWEL --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You okay? LOCKE'S REFLECTION appears in the mirror. Ana Lucia continues to clean her wound, PISSED OFF AT HERSELF.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: He was playing (fucking) possum. Locke’s got his own reasons for hating Henry right about feels her frustration --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Well, he’s not playing anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You tied him up.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Good and tight. Locke lingers in the doorway, something clearly on his mi A BEAT, then his curiosity wins out -- LOCKE (CONT’D) What was he saying to you?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Nothing much. He’s just angry.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Angry about what? Well that was fucking DIRECT. A BEAT, then -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: (eyes down) I killed a couple of his “friends.”

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Well. I’m sure it was in self- defense.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: First one came into our camp one night to take our kids. (beat) I hit her with a rock. ON LOCKE. Listening as Ana continues -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) The second one was pretending to be one of us. Said his name was Goodwin. I jammed a spear through his chest. A beat. Okay. Not exactly self-defense. We eagerly await Locke’s thoughts on all this. But all he does is point to the GASH on Ana’s forehead --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: You need stitches.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You got a needle and thread?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Not on me. OFF ANA LUCIA, frowning as she turns back to the mirror -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE'RE WIDE ON JACK carrying Michael up a STEEP INCLINE. K can be seen close behind. TIGHTER ON JACK. INTENSITY IN HIS EYES AS SWEAT POURS dow his FACE as he struggles. Kate clocks his effort --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How ‘bout a break, Jack?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: We'll rest at the top. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A COUPLE SILENT BEATS as Jack takes the last PAINFUL STEP the top of the hill. FINALLY, they reach the top. Jack pu Michael down gently, tries to catch his own breath as he a hand on Michael’s forehead --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No fever.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What do you think happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I don’t... He’s been on his own for two weeks -- he’s exhausted, dehydrated... And then? Michael MUMBLES something. Jack leans in --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Michael? It’s Jack, man -- can you hear me? Michael? Michael’s lips move a little -- Jack STRAINS to listen -- then Michael’s OUT again. Jack blinks, pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What’d he say? Did you -- ?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (beat; then) He said “Walt.” A MOMENT as that plays. Kate just STARES at Jack --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Kate clocks Jack’s EXHAUSTION. Remembers the moment they shared before Michael stumbled out -- the closeness of it

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Gimme a sec to catch my breath. Kate steps up -- takes one of Michael’s limp arms and dra it over her shoulder. Manages to bring him to a SITTING POSITION. Jack looks at her, understands the gesture -- she’s going to help him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do everything alone, Jack. He considers it, then takes Michael’s other arm. Together they lift him to his feet. Jack gives Kate a quick glance grateful for her help. AND OFF THE TWO OF THEM, working together to bring Michael home -- EXT. BEACH - LIBBY’S AREA —- MORNING 8 LIBBY and HURLEY are practicing their new EXERCISE REGIME PACING DOWN TO THE SHORELINE AND BACK, all the while play a new game called “I miss” --

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: I miss my bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: I miss my hog.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: You had a motorcycle?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: No, I had a potbellied pig. His name was Chester... Libby just LAUGHS. Then --

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: I miss music. The perfect song -- y'know, that matches your mood.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Dude, there’s a whole record collection in the hatch. lLet’s go.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: There’s also a prisoner down there. Kind’ve a mood... killer, y'know?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Uhm, yeah... good point. But something’s caught Libby’s eye down the beach.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Hurley -- will you excuse me for a minute? And lest we be curious as to what it is she just saw...  12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia’s WOUND, as REFLECTED in a SHARP of MIRROR --

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What happened? WIDEN TO REVEAL Ana Lucia’s got a needle and thread and i about to sew up her own fucking head using a propped up COMPACT MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Cut myself shaving.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Stop that. Let me. Ana Lucia looks up -- HARDCORE. Part of her WANTS to go through the suffering of stitching herself, but after a b she hands the needle to Libby. A beat as Libby sits across from her, studies the GASH. A can feel her eyes on her, waiting for an explanation...

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Guy in the hatch tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m fine. Libby clocks her -- she’s not fine, she’s fucking ANGRY.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Ana?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Don’t do anything stupid. Ana says nothing -- but their eyes meet, hold a beat. Lib shakes her head... then LEANS IN -- LIBBY (CONT’D) Okay. This is gonna hurt. And OFF ANA, GRITTING HER TEETH before the needle PUNCHES  10 11 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locke leans on his crutches as he stands in the ENTRYWAY the living area. Reaches his fingers as high as they’1ll to touch the TEETH of the BLAST DOOR that resides in the above him. The blast door with the fucking MAP on it. A BEAT. Another BEAT. And Locke finally turns towards the ARMORY DOOR. PUSHING IN. And although Henry’s a liar... someone who just tried to KILL one of our castaways... He’s John Locke’s only fucking shot at ANSWERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOTAL DARKNESS as THE DOOR SLIDES OPEN, casting a SHAFT O LIGHT on Henry, sitting on the COT. Henry is not only bound by his wrists, but he is also TETHERED to the bed. And fucking TIGHTLY, too. ON LOCKE. Backlit. Very fucking NOIR. Just looking at Henry. Trying to... make sense of him. The silent moment PLAYS. Then --

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: If you’ve come to apologize, I forgive you for hitting me with your crutch. (beat) I’m glad my head didn’t break it. Boy, is he fucking smug. And Locke ain’t one bit amused -

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Now there’s a broad question.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Why did you try to hurt Ana Lucia and not me? ON HENRY. His eyes dance with intelligence. But --

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I’m not sure I know what you’re getting at, John. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: I was trapped under that blast door. Helpless. You could’ve crushed my skull. And you didn’t do_a thing. Why didn’t -- ?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Because you're one of the good ones, John.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Good... whats?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) None of it matters. I’m dead anyway. Locke listens with deep skepticism. HENRY (CONT’D) The doctor went out to make a trade, and you and I both know he’1l come back empty-handed. And then? (simple; cold) I have lost my value. Locke’s mind spins with the implications. And Henry is ROLLING now -- ON LOCKE. HENRY (CONT’D) So either Jack comes back and kills me or my people find where I’m being held and they do it.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Why would your own people -- ?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Because the man in charge? He’s a great man, John -- a brilliant man. (a flash of FEAR) But he is not a forgiving man. Forgetting why he even fucking came in here. Totally caught up in Henry’s download. HENRY (CONT’D) They’11 kill me because I failed, John. I failed my mission. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: What... “mission”?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: When that... woman caught me in her trap... I was on my way here, John.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY A COMMOTION CAN BE HEARD FROM THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: VOICES -- SEVERAL PEOPLE ENTERING THE HATCH -- KATE’S VOI

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Locke looks towards Kate’s VOICE, but quickly turns back Henry. And we are SUPER TIGHT on him as he softly says --

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I was on my way here, John, because I_was_ coming for you. HOLY. FUCKING. SHIT. NOW JACK’S VOICE --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: LOCKE! Get out here! ON HENRY. Laid bare. Not a shred of the Lecter bullshit - he’s as GENUINE as we've ever seen him. ON LOCKE. Head SPINNING. Doesn’t know whether he’s being fucked with or he’s just been given the meaning of LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: And as Locke turns to see Jack and Kate hauling MICHAEL i the living area, he SNAPS OUT OF IT. And with one last look at Henry -- DESPERATE Henry -- Loc SLIDES the door SHUT -- snuffing out that single stream o light and plunging us into -- BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A METAL DETECTOR WAND as it TRAVELS ACROSS THE B of a MAN -- ARM AROUND TO REVEAL Ana Lucia in a TSA (Transportation Security Administration) UNIFORM -- that’s right, since leaving the force, Ana Lucia’s been working the worst job the world: AIRPORT SECURITY. She waves the man through. And as her next victim approaches, WE LINGER A BEAT on Ana Lucia’s FACE, and see clearly how much she hates what she’s doing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia, in her STREET CLOTHES now, BELLIES UP TO THE AIRPORT BAR. This is a VERY familiar ritual for her.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike. Tequila and tonic. Ana settles down on a stool. Takes off her JACKET. And th WE HEAR a MAN’S VOICE one stool over --

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nice to see you again. And Ana Lucia turns to see: CHRISTIAN SHEPHARD. Yup. Jack's Dad. Dr. Fucking Shephard. Here he is, in the flesh, smiling at Ana Lucia, and draining a SCOTCH, while indicating to the bartender that he’d like another. But while we can’t believe our fucking eyes, remember, he stranger to Ana Lucia. He SMILES --

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: You wanded me. At security. Ana gets her drink, sucks on the LIME. And Shephard seems be AMUSED by the fact that she’s completely IGNORING him.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So how does somebody get into wanding? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I used to be a cop.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: What a coincidence. I used to be a doctor. Shephard gets his drink. Takes a BIG gulp. And Ana -- wel she’s actually kind’ve drawn in by this guy. Why? Who fucking knows. But she answers.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Why’d you quit?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: I didn’t. My son ratted me out for drinking on the job. Lost my license. Ana Lucia, shakes her head, SMILES -- SHEPHARD (CONT’D) Yeah. Hilarious, I know.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: No... It’s just -- I don’t think parents and kids should work together. Too many... issues.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: (smiles; BINGO) I will drink to that. Ana SMILES. Raises her glass. They CLINK.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: So where you headed?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Sydney. Sydney, Australia. (beat; thinks; then) Wanna comes?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Ha.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: I’m serious.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Sure you are. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Iam. Flight leaves at eleven. Ana shakes her head, what the hell is UP with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Why would I go to Sydney with you?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Why wouldn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Because you're a stranger. And you've had two drinks just since I’ve been talking to you. And I don’t go to (fucking) Australia just to... go. Christian moves over a seat. Not sexual at all -- but definitely more... INTIMATE.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: I always have two drinks for the road because it’s good luck and I don’t want to crash. And if you need a reason to go to Australia, here’s a great one -- (beat) What I’m doing down there is dangerous. I need someone to protect me. A bodyguard. Perfect for someone who “used to be a cop.”

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Protect you from what?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Does it matter? Ana Lucia just looks at him. He looks back. Somehow, KINDRED SPIRITS. After a beat, he reaches into his leathe CARRY-ON. Pulls out a worn MANILA ENVELOPE. Reaches inside... roots around -- and extracts a WAD OF HUNDRED DOLLAR BILLS. Pushes it across to Ana Lucia. SHEPHARD (CONT’D) Payment in advance.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You’re crazy, man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Maybe. (then) But maybe I’m not and fate has thrown you and me together. Two drinks in at an airport bar.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: And why would “fate” do that?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Same reason fate does anything... so we can help each other. (beat) Don’t you need help? And this time when he looks at her, it’s a REAL MOMENT. Bonding. She can see the same thing in his eyes we can -- real level of SADNESS AND DESPERATION. And Ana Lucia is actually fucking CONSIDERING THIS. She looks down at the money. Back up at Shephard, points to herself and then to him --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: That ain’t gonna happen. And if we don’t get her gist, Shephard certainly does --

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Darlin’ -- I couldn’t if I tried. She SMILES. Charmed by his honesty.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I don’t even know your name.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Let’s not use our real names. That keeps it nice and... professional. Tell you what... you pick mine, I‘1l pick yours. Ana Lucia shakes her head -- can’t believe she’s fucking getting into this. But she IS getting into it. So --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You look like a “Tom” to me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Tom is an excellent name. (thinks; then) And you... should be “Sarah.” Ana nods. So fucking be it. She raises her eyebrow --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You said two was good luck, huh? Shephard SMILES back --

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: I believe I did. And Shephard raises his finger to the bartender -- SHEPHARD (CONT’D) Another drink for the lady. And OFF ANA LUCIA, a FLASH OF AMBIVALENCE -- not exactly WHY the fuck she just agreed to WHAT she just agreed to.. but that doesn’t really matter right now... Because she’s going to fucking SYDNEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ANA LUCIA staring up at something... and then -- WHACK WHACK -- we see a MANGO PULL INTO FRAME and DROP INTO A T WIDEN TO REVEAL SAWYER having rigged up a device to KNOCK FRUIT from the TREE. He suddenly realizes HE’S NOT ALONE. Sawyer looks over and sees Ana Lucia packing the mangos i his canvas bag. He looks suspicious that she’s helping, walks over --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: I got it.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Didn’t figure you for the fruit- picking type.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Whatt’ya want?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Can’t a person make conversation? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: A person can. You can’t. You ain’t ever talked to me except to say “shut-up” or “five minutes,” and now you wanna be my best friend? Whatt’ya want, Small-fry? Sawyer hits the ground, takes his sack from her. Ana Luci smiles, busted --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I need a gun.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Course you do. (shakes his head) If I’d known everyone was gonna come askin’ every damn day, I never would’ve stole ‘em in the first place. This island needs to repeal the damned Second Amendment. Ana Lucia just looks at him. He GRINS --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s the one about guns.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: (fuck you) Funny. Ana Lucia keeps her expression even but Sawyer clocks... something. Whatever she wants it for, it ain’t GOOD.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Hey, here’s an idea: Why not go to your buddy, Jack? He’s got himself a gun. (snaps his fingers) Oh, right -- he’s still traipsing through the jungle with Kate.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: If you've got a problem ‘cause he’s making time with your girlfriend, don’t take it out on me, man. Sawyer looks at her, his eyes cold -- he can throw out wi ass remarks all day, but Ana just hit him where he LIVES. And she doesn’t let up. Takes a step forward. Eye to EYE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) So how about you just give me a gun.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Here’s another idea -- scram. Ana blinks. A beat. But Sawyer’s OVER IT now --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You heard me. Not git. She eyes him like she just might bite his fucking nose of But after a beat, she breaks away. Turns around. And walk off. AND OFF SAWYER, watching her go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MICHAEL’S EYE as Jack carefully PULLS IT OPEN. They’re in the “INFIRMARY.” Michael on the bottom bunk.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Michael... But Michael AIN’T REALLY THERE. PUPILS rolled up.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So it worked. Jack turns to see Locke standing in the door, observing t

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, John?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Your deal -- the trade. If they gave us Michael back...

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: They didn’t give us anything. Locke is slightly CONFUSED. Not to mention, his head is still fucking TRIPPED OUT from his conversation with Henr

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: So it’s just a coincidence that he came wandering out when you --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I was shouting. He heard my voice. Locke nods, noncommittally. Jack getting DEFENSIVE now -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? They sent Michael back just hoping we’d keep up our end of the bargain? You think they’re on the (fucking)... honor system? Kate enters with FRESH WATER, immediately clocks THE TENS

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey. Jack takes the water bottle and moves to Michael. ON LOCK After a moment, he wordlessly HOBBLES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SAYID, digging a hole. A VOICE calls out to him --

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dude, nice hole. Sayid looks up and see Hurley approaching.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: What is it, Hurley?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, man... you remember that radio we made? I thought maybe I could, like, get it to play some music, y'know... for Libby. Ah. There it is. Sayid nods, sympathetic --

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: It worked only once and then just for a minute. I’ve tried numerous times since and gotten only static.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: I know, but here’s the thing... even that’d be good. ‘Cause then Libby’1l be all like, “It’s the thought that counts.” Then I score major points. Especially when she sees me holding it over my head. Sayid looks at Hurley -- confused. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: And why would you hold a static generating radio over your head?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: They didn’t have “Say Anything” in Baghdad? (off his blank look) It’s awesome. This dude like gets a boom-box, and holds it over his head outside the chick’s window, and he plays some Peter Gabriel song. And bam. The girl’s like, his. I mean, after her father goes to jail. But then he gets her. And he’s a kickboxer --

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: I think I get the idea.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: You should check it out sometime. I mean, if we ever, y'know, get off the island. Sayid shakes his head. Charmed by the site of young love.

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: If you want to do something nice for Libby, there’s a beautiful beach maybe three kilometers from here. Pack a picnic basket and take her there.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: You think that’d work? Sayid nods. Yes, he does. Hurley’s starting to dig this plan. Then Sayid resumes digging, his smile fading as --

dialogues.speaker: SAYID
dialogues.text: I took Shannon there once. Oh yeah. Shannon. Remember her? Hurley does. Suddenly feels for Sayid. But Sayid quickly lets him off the hook

dialogues.speaker: SAYID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you like directions? As Hurley NODS back...  17 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SAWYER as he walks through the jungle. He stops. Looks around. Produces a papaya from his pack and takes a bite. Chews. Then, he starts moving again. A BEAT. Then he SUDDENLY STOPS. There it is -- that RUSTLING behind him. And then it stops. Yup, there’s somebody out there. He turns --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Come out, come out, whoever you are. Nothing. Not a sound. And now, Sawyer draws his GUN --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you’re there -- don’t make me come in after you. A beat, then -- Ana Lucia emerges from the brush.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, well, well -- look what we got here. Was Little Red Riding Hood gonna follow the Big Bad Wolf to his stash o’ guns?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Why not gimme that one right there. Sawyer puts the gun back in his waistband --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: I ain’t gonna gimmyou nothin’. But Ana Lucia isn’t taking no for an answer, starts movin towards him --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You and me been over this, Lucy -- -- She keeps right on going, getting right in his face --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! -- And WHAM! Ana Lucia fucking PUNCHES HIM IN THE FACE! Sawy stumbles backward -- goes down like a sack of wheat!

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the -- ? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia jumps on top of him, tries to hold him down -- And while Sawyer doesn’t exactly hate being this close to he ain’t letting this little chickie get the best of him. wastes no time in using his superior strength to flip her over. BOOM. Her BACK SLAMS AGAINST the jungle floor. Now HE’S ON TOP and pinning her down. He leans in close. She feels his breath on her face --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’cha gonna do now, Muchacha? They’re sweaty, nose to nose. Heat and anger burning from their eyes, their bodies pressed tightly together. And ju as we wonder what she’s going to do, Ana Lucia suddenly j her head up and meets Sawyer’s lips with her own. Holy shit. Her mouth is hungry; she’s more biting and grabbing at him than kissing him. And even in his surpris Sawyer wastes no time in opening his mouth to her and giv it right back. She reaches for his head and SMASHES IT between her hands a VICE GRIP. Her hands slide down his scalp, PULLING HIS HAIR BACK as she ROLLS ON TOP OF HIM. ONCE THERE, she puts one hand on his neck while pulling h hair back with the other. All the while KISSING HIM. And quickly he’s had enough, FLIPS HER OVER AGAIN and HOLDS H HANDS DOWN OVER HER HEAD. HE RUNS HIS HAND down her TORSO and then, in ONE DEFT MOV HE PULLS HER SHIRT OFF. She squirms beneath him, IN ONLY BRA. Now it’s her turn -- SHE FLIPS HIM OVER, GRABS HIS BELT, YANKS IT OFF and FLINGS IT out of the way. They KISS, angry, HARD, and it’s impossible to tell reall whether they want to FIGHT OR FUCK. He looks at her, wondering how far this is going to go. And Ana’s response to unbutton SAWYER’S PANTS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COVERED BY ANA LUCIA’S SHIRT. AND AS SAWYER’S GUN FALLS ON TOP OF THE PILE... SMASH TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON A PAIR OF JEANS, laying on the jungle floor as a HAND reaches into FRAME and grabs them. WIDEN TO REVEAL shirtless Sawyer. Getting dressed in all post-coital glory. HE STEALS A GLANCE AT -- Ana Lucia’s BACK as she throws on her familiar black tank top. She turns around, catches him looking at her --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: What? Jesus. This is AWKWARD. And now Ana Lucia simply takes of Not a word or a look to Sawyer who can’t believe his usua role of loving ‘em and leaving ‘em is being reversed. Thi is the PERFECT SCENARIO -- she’s fucking leaving.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Don’t you want my phone number? Ana Lucia turns around, her eyes smoldering --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: If you tell anyone about this, I’1ll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Guess that takes cuddlin’ off the table. And we PUSH IN TIGHT on Ana Lucia’s FACE as she goes, not even a hint of a smile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia lies on top of the kicked out sheets of her bed Insomnia-ville. CANNOT FUCKING SLEEP. She looks at the CLOCK RADIO. 3:51 A.M. FUCK. She gets up out of bed, opens the MINI-BAR. Cracks open a mini bottle of tequila and pours it in a glass. She mixes some tonic, but doesn’t drink. She whirls it with her fin instead, as she moves to the window and looks out at the twinkling lights of Sydney Harbour. She stares out, wonders how in fuck she got here... SUDDE -- POUNDING ON HER DOOR -- only one person it could be. S puts the drink down and moves to the DOOR -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Saarrah. Open the damn door! Yeah. Christian. She opens the door TO REVEAL A VERY DRUN Christian Shephard holding the door frame to steady himse SHEPHARD (CONT’D) Good, you’re up. Protection duty... It’s time. Let’s go. Ana Lucia looks at him, suspicious and skeptical --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: After four days of drinking... doing nothing -- now in the middle of the night, you’re ready to go? He nods. Damn STRAIGHT --

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: That’s exactly right. Now, c’mon... It’s time. Get dressed. OFF ANA LUCIA, pondering. What the fuck. Sooner started, sooner finished. AND AS THUNDER CRASHES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN POURS DOWN AS A LONE CAR cruises ghost-like down the street in a working class neighborhood of modest homes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia drives. Christian swigs from a MINI BOTTLE of scotch. He scans the street, points to a RUN-DOWN HOUSE w a RUSTED OUT JEEP parked in the driveway --

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: That’s it -- that’s the one. Pull in!

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: This is what I’m protecting you from? The suburbs?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Just stay here.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: (pissed) Should I keep the meter running? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Christian’s out of the car, SLAMMING the door, and heading up the front walk. He’s INSTANTLY SOAKED.

dialogues.speaker: WE STAY IN THE CAR WITH ANA LUCIA, WINDSHIELD WIPERS GOIN
dialogues.text: watching from HER POV as -- CHRISTIAN RINGS THE BELL AND KNOCKS ON THE DOOR. Aman ona mission... Finally, a light comes on. Then the door opens, revealing LINDSEY, an attractive but weathered blonde in her FORTIE She’s surprised to see Christian and not very happy about Christian -- DRUNK AND IMPASSIONED -- tries to explain something to her -- and from the looks of it, it’s someth that’s been weighing on his mind for a long time. Whatever the explanation, it ain’t working. Lindsey start to CRY, cinches her robe tighter, and SHAKES HER HEAD, NO Christian starts to YELL in frustration, his voice RISING A LEVEL where Ana Lucia can NOW HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD LINDSEY
dialogues.text: Tell me where she is --!! -- Go home, Christian. You’re drunk!

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD LINDSEY
dialogues.text: She’s my daughter. I havea right to see her! -- You don’t have any rights. Get OUT! Lindsey tries to SLAM THE DOOR CLOSED, but Christian stic his foot in it. She pushes hard against the door, and Christian APPLIES A SHOULDER AND -- BLAM! -- IT BASHES OP That’s enough for Ana Lucia -- EXT. LINDSEY’S HOUSE - SYDNEY - NIGHT - FLASHBACK 22 She’s out of the car and rushing for the house as -- Christian tries to PUSH IN PAST Lindsey, but she HOLDS HE

dialogues.speaker: GET
dialogues.text: -- This is MY house! I pay your mortgage! Let me -- Christian GRABS Lindsey, TRIES TO MOVE HER. SHE SCREAMS - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia rolls up and pops Christian with a forearm to t side of the head -- STOPS HIM -- grabs him in AN ARM BAR.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: OW!! What (the fuck) are you doing?! Let go of me! Lindsey clearly has no idea who this WOMAN is who has com her aid, but she doesn’t really care. SHOUTS at Shephard

dialogues.speaker: LINDSEY
dialogues.text: DON’T EVER COME BACK HERE! Ana Lucia’s got control of him. This is cop 101. She uses her arm bar leverage to turn Christian around --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: It’s okay. We’re leaving...

dialogues.speaker: LINDSEY
dialogues.text: You get him away from me! He’s poison. He’s poison! That sentiment LANDS on Ana Lucia as she marches Christia across the LAWN, both of them getting DRENCHED in the rai

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Let me GO. I was just having a conversation --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Your conversation’s (fucking) over.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: You work for me! She TORQUES his arm harder, gets him to the car --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Shut up. She opens the CAR DOOR and shoves him inside. Gives one l look back to the house -- And as Ana Lucia locks eyes with Lindsey, a MOMENT. And a Lindsey shakes her head, a sense of PITY from this comple stranger... Pity that Ana is now saddled with the same ma she clearly fucking HATES...  23 31. EXT. BEACH —- PANTRY - DAY 23

dialogues.speaker: A STICK OF DHARMA INITIATIVE SALAMI. WIDEN TO
dialogues.text: REVEAL Hurley, tossing it into his backpack. He’s at the COMMUNAL PANTRY, going through the shelves of food, loading up. DHARMA CHEDDAR SPREAD, DHARMA SALTINES, DHARMA OLIVES... he stuffs ‘em all in when he hears --

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey there, how’s it going? Hurley freezes, deer in headlights. Turns around with a guilty look to see -- Libby.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Uh... it’s not what it looks like. Libby eyes the bag of goodies. Looks back at Hurley --

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: And what does it look like?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: It looks like... stuff... that it’s... not? (beat) Man, I’m so busted.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Hurley, I’m not here to tell you how to act around food.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: No, I’m not busted for that, I’m busted for... something... else. Fuck. He didn’t want to have to ruin what he was planning but, now he has no choice -- HURLEY (CONT’D) I was packing for a picnic. And I was kinda hoping... you’d go with me... as, like, an... us thing. But it was a... uh... surprise.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Really? Hurley blushes, nods sheepishly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: So do you, like, wanna go?

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Can that part still be a surprise? Libby grins at him. Genuinely excited. And she NODS. And OFF HURLEY’S DELIGHTED SMILE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack’s at the SINK washing his INSTRUMENT TRAY. Locke’s tightening the screws on the CRUTCH he used to clobber He They are NOT TALKING, THEN --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey. You're back. Jack looks up to see Ana Lucia entering the LIVING SPACE.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey. She looks at him. Then --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: So the Others... They didn’t show up?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Nope. (then) But Michael’s back.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: (surprised) What -- ? When did he...? But Jack’s clocked the WOUND on the side of her head --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What happened to you? Ana Lucia’s hand goes to the WOUND. Fuck. This is gonna take some explaining and she sure as shit doesn’t wanna d it. But before she opens her mouth -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s my fault. Both Jack and Ana Lucia turn to see Locke, calmly sketchi his “map” as he sits in the NOOK --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I must’ve left the tap on in the bathroom sink, it flooded over. Ana wiped out, banged her head on the counter. (to Ana) Again -- I’m sorry about that. A moment ON LOCKE -- long enough to realize that he knows what might happen to Henry if his attempted murder came t light. And that he ain’t done TALKING to him. Ana Lucia is SURPRISED he covered her, but grateful, too.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Don’t worry about it. And Jack? He’s NOT sure what the fuck is going on, but wh the hell would they lie about it? And that’s EXACTLY when

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And as all three heads turn towards the sound of Kate's voice. Towards the BEDROOM -- INT. HATCH —- BEDROOM AREA - DAY 25 CLOSE ON KATE, nervous and excited as she leans by Michae side. His eyes are FLUTTERING --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I think he’s waking up... Locke and Ana Lucia enter behind Jack who moves to the be kneels, gently puts his hand on Michael’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Hey, Michael? Michael?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Jack...? Jack smiles as he exchanges a look with Kate, RELIEVED -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Man... where... how did I...?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Try to take it easy, okay? You’re back in the hatch -- we found you in the jungle last night.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: My head... How long’ve I -- ?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: You were gone twelve days. Michael looks over at Locke. A MOMENT. For those of us wh have forgotten, Michael SMASHED Locke over the head befor ran off. Nods a somewhat shamed greeting --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Hey, John.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: (nods back) Welcome back. Michael GRUNTS as he pulls himself into a sitting positio Takes the bottle of water Kate offers him. ON ANA as she watches him gulp it down. And the minute he’s finished --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I found them. Okay. SHIT. None of our folks need to ask who “them” is. And we let that play because what Michael’s about to say? Well, we’ve been waiting for ANY fucking information abou these bastards for the better part of two seasons now.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: After I left... I hiked north. (looks to Ana Lucia) Back to where we were. I dug myself a hide-out -- waited there for five days, but nobody came. So I left. Hiked to the beach and started following the shore. (beat) Day later, I saw one. ON LOCKE. Mega fucking ENGAGED --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: What did he... look like? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Dirty. Worn out clothing. No shoes. Simple. Just like the rest of them.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: The rest of them?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (intense) Yeah. His people. The “Others.” I followed him back to his camp. Ana Lucia and Jack share a look. CHRIST -- Michael found where the OTHERS FUCKING LIVE.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They live in tents. Canvas tents and... tee-pees. They eat... dried fish -- they’re worse off than we are. ON OUR GROUP. Not what they were expecting at fucking ALL

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: No buildings? No structures? Michael shakes his head. NOPE.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How many of them are there?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I counted twenty-two.

dialogues.speaker: JACK MICHAEL
dialogues.text: The boat that -- ? -- Didn’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Did you... see Walt? A MOMENT. ON MICHAEL. Emotional.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No. (then; confident) But I know he’s there.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: What about everyone else they took? Cindy? Did you see any other kids? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: No. No kids. But I think they’re in the same place as my boy. ON EVERYONE. Speechless. Just letting Michael talk now --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They have a hatch. As that lands --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How do you know they -- ?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: There’s a set of metal doors leading into the ground. What else would it be?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: And you think the kids are inside?

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (nods ) They keep it guarded 24/7. Two guards... two guns. And two guns is all I saw. (temper rising) They’re barely armed. They’re old. And half of ‘em are women. Even so, I couldn't... I wanted to -- Michael gets choked up -- A RISING FRUSTRATION --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I couldn’t save him. So I came back to tell you. (looks up; eyes burning) To tell you that we can take them. ON JACK, activated on a NEW LEVEL. Holy shit -- IT’S ON.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Soon as I get my strength back. I will take us back there. (fierce determination) And we're gonna get my son back. The clarity and undeniably of this mission lands on them ON LOCKE. ON KATE AND JACK, sharing a look. AND FINALLY - OFF ANA LUCIA. They are ALL AMPED and READY TO GO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting DARK now. Hurley holds back a tree branch to let Libby through to a small clearing --

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Watch your head -- almost there... Libby ducks and makes her way under. Stops to look around

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: You ever watch “The Flintstones”?

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Sure -- I used to watch it all the time in the hospital... OOPS. Hurley stammers, the worst job of covering ever -- HURLEY (CONT’D) When I... broke my, uh... hip. And for obvious reasons, Libby lets him off the hook. Smi as they walk on --

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Well, did you ever notice how Fred would run by the same thing over and over again? (points) Third time past that tree.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: That's a... different tree.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: It’s okay if you’re lost --

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: -- I’m not lost, dude. Trust me -- we're about to walk right out onto the beach and...! Sure enough, they emerge onto SAND. Hurley turns, HUGE GR HURLEY (CONT’D) Surprise! Libby looks around, shakes her head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Hurley, this is our beach. (points to the shallows) There’s Jin. And sure enough, JIN is there cleaning a FISH. He sees th and offers a friendly wave. HURLEY’S FACE FALLS -- LIBBY (CONT’D) (smiles; optimistically) Hey -- why not have a picnic right here? Here, give me the blankets.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Blankets?

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: You don’t have blankets. (okay; then...) How about drinks? Hurley turns red. Forgot that, too. Libby smiles reassuringly -- LIBBY (CONT’D) Tell you what -- I’1l handle the blankets and you track down Rose and Bernard. I saw them pull some wine from the pallet. Hurley even MORE red now. This sounds like a DATE.

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Oh. Wine. Uh... groovy. (smiles goofily) Hey, maybe if I get drunk enough I‘1ll be able to remember where I know you from. UH-FUCKING-OH. ON LIBBY, her smile fades ever so slightly because WE know where he knows her from. But then? She SMILES. And it’s GENUINE. The sense that maybe it’s time to come clean. Hell -- she LIKES him.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. Libby turns to go, but before she gets too far -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HURLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Libby! (she turns) If you, uh -- wanted to call me Hugo, that’d be cool.

dialogues.speaker: LIBBY
dialogues.text: You got it, Hugo. A big SMILE as she turns back and heads off, we linger on HURLEY. Smiling WIDER than he’s ever smiled before -- INT. HATCH —- GEODOME - DAY 39. 26 27 Locke sits at the computer working on his MAP as Jack ent And there’s something about Jack right now... He is actua PENSIVE. Awkward. He’s got something to say and now he ju fucking says it --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You were right.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Right about what?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: About Henry. Locke looks UP. Whoa. This is fucking big.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What you and Sayid did to him when you first found him... You were... right. I never should’ve... (beat; owning it) I don’t like how you did it, but I shouldn't have got in your way. And that’s about as close to SORRY as Jack Shephard ever

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: You did what you thought was right at the time you thought it, Jack. Jack NODS, relieved that Locke is being so chill.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I hope the next time you decide to do something, you include me. (beat; pointed) And something tells me that’s gonna be soon. And then -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: THERE IT IS. Fun time over. Locke and Jack are, at least for the next two minutes, BACK IN BUSINESS together. Jack gets off the couch, IMPASSIONED NOW --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You heard what Michael said? We can take them.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: (devil’s advocate) Our friend with the beard told us not to cross the “line.”

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: These people are liars, John -- why the hell should we take their word for anything? A beat as Locke looks across the hatch to the ARMORY DOOR And the man fucking BEHIND it. And then --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: I couldn’t agree more. ON LOCKE, fierce DETERMINATION twinkling in his eyes -- LOCKE (CONT’D) So... now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON KATE as she fills a bottle of water at the sink. Feels something weird. Looks up to find Ana Lucia leaning again the nook. And she’s just... STARING at her.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Nothin’... (then; points) It’s just -- that’s my shirt. Uh... what? Kate looks down at the shirt she’s wearing, instantly self-conscious --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh. I... found it in the luggage.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Looks good on you. You keep it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (Producer’s note: And before we get busted on this, the p scene where we played this gag was cut from that show.) A Lucia SMILES at the absurdity of the situation. And now K smiles BACK. Wow, could they actually be bonding? That’s when Jack and Locke enter -- and you can feel the TENSION -- they’re READY TO MOVE -- PACKS ON THEIR SHOULD

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Where are you going...?

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: To get our guns back from Sawyer.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to Kate) And we’re gonna need you to help... convince him. ON KATE as she mulls the CONNOTATIONS of this. Then --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna take care of Michael? Ana Lucia saves them from the decision --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I’ll stay. You guys go ahead. Give Sawyer my best.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You sure? She NODS. Yeah -- she’s fucking SURE.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thanks. We’1ll be back soon. Now Kate grabs HER pack, and the three of them exit out. as soon as they’re gone... we PUSH IN ON ANA LUCIA, as sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia’s behind the wheel. Quiet. Next to her, Shephard, dishevelled from their TOUSLE on t front lawn, tips his mini-bottle all the way back, draini the very last drop into his throat. He reaches out to the car radio -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: We need some damn music in here. Shephard finds something mournful and bluesy. The two dri on silently for a few beats. Then --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Who was she?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Who was who?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: (“don’t play around”) That woman.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: She? Is a very long story, Sarah.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: My name’s Ana Lucia. Shephard acknowledges that Ana no longer wants to play hi game. A beat. And then --

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Well, I’m still “Tom.” She shakes her head, getting pretty SICK of this --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You're pathetic is what you are.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: You bet your sweet ass I am. He reaches over to CRANK up the radio, but Ana’s had ENOU FRUSTRATED -- she CRANKS THE WHEEL -- SCREEEEECH -- PULLS OVER TO THE CURB, SLAMS it into PARK -- TURNS ON Shephard

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: What the hell are we -- ? Why are you here, man?

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Why are you here? ON ANA. Shit. Well, that’s a GOOD FUCKING QUESTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHEPHARD (CONT’D) Because I know exactly why I’m here. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m here because I can’t apologize to my son. He tried to help me and I... I thanked him by cutting him off. By hating him. (beat; pointed) Your turn, Ana... OUCH. Ana feels like she’s been SLAPPED. SHEPHARD (CONT’D) You fly halfway around the world with a stranger at the drop of a hat and I’m “pathetic”?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You said you needed someone to protect you! Not just sit around and watch you (fucking) drink! A beat. Shephard looks at her. And here’s that terrible part of him we’ve seen in the past. That MEAN part.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: You came here for the same reason I did, kiddo. You ran away. That’s pretty much a verbal KNOCKOUT PUNCH. Ana Lucia loo away, pissed and sad that this fucker is right. A BEAT, then Shephard suddenly SMILES as he CLOCKS SOMETH ACROSS THE STREET. SHEPHARD (CONT’D) Well. Look where fate’s delivered us this time... Ana follows his eyes. There, across the street, a BAR -- “THE LAST CALL.” Shephard offers a sad smile.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: It’s five-thirty in the morning!

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: Good, we won’t have to fight the crowds. Let’s go have a drink or ten and be pathetic together. C'mon... Ana Lucia looks at him -- a mixture of PITY and ANGER. An her answer JUST COMES OUT --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: No... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She’s having herself an EPIPHANY HERE. A moment of CLARIT where she SEES that SHEPARD is MERELY HERSELF four steps the road. More FORCEFUL now --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: If that’s your call... He seems disappointed, but turns the DOOR HANDLE to leave As it swings open -- SLAM -- it CRASHES into a PEDESTRIAN

dialogues.speaker: PEDESTRIAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m walking here! And the fucking voice is damn familiar. HOLY FUCKING SHIT we’re on HIS BACK BUT WE SEE ENOUGH OF HIM TO KNOW THAT I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia turns back towards Shephard as he gets out --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Wait... Because her gut is telling her that if she lets this guy in that bar something fucking terrible is going to happen And we know she’s right, because after Christian Shephard a_heart-to-heart with Sawyer in that bar, he is going to in the fucking alley behind it. ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) Don’t. You don’t have to -- let’s just get the hell out of Sydney. (beat; emotional) Let’s just go... back. Shephard looks at her. Then, softly BECAUSE IT’S SO FUCKI

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHARD
dialogues.text: I can’t ever go back. (then) See ya, kiddo. And with that, Christian Shephard gets out of the car. An WALKS OFF, across the street. And into that bar, like a m to the gallows. And OFF ANA LUCIA as she watches him go..  30 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A MANUSCRIPT. WE READ THE TITLE, “BAD TWIN.” WIDENING find it in the hands of Sawyer in front of his CAMPFIRE. Totally ENGROSSED --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: Sawyer. Sawyer barely looks up as Kate, Jack and Locke (on crutch approach his tent. Just turns the page --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put the book down.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: It ain’t a book, it’s a manuscript, and I’m gonna be the first and only guy to find out who-done-it. (turns another page) I think I might’ve figured it out, so just cool your damn jets and take a walk around the coconut trees. Only got ten pages to go.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You wanna figure it out? But Jack’s jets ain’t gonna cool, so he GRABS THE MANUSCR RIPS OUT the last several PAGES and THROWS THEM IN THE FI

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: He leaps up, GRABS a stick -- KNOCKS the flaming pages ou the fire -- STOMPS THEM OUT. Takes a knee to find that th pages are half ASH.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell d’you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Time to give us the guns back.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: (are you fucking KIDDING?) You burn the ending of my book and now you want me to --

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Where are they, James? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: You to, Brutus?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Just... take us there, Sawyer. Okay? Stop playing around --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: (to Jack) What? You brought her along for the sympathy vote? Well she ain’t in my head, Doc, so go screw. Ow. ON KATE, uncomfortable that Sawyer has crossed into t territory. Jack deals with it another way -- pulls out HI fucking gun, sticks it in Sawyer’s face --

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Take us to the guns. Right now. Now Sawyer has a moment of realization. He doesn’t have h fucking gun! He forgot about it. He involuntarily reaches anyway for the back of his waistband, like you’d check fo your missing wallet. Nothing! Double fuck.

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: That bitch. She stole my damn gun. (off Jack's look) Ana Lucia.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: How'd she do that? Sawyer’s not about to tell Jack that --

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What does she need a gun for? Locke knows why: to get fucking revenge. He realizes he might have se usly fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKE
dialogues.text: Jack. I need to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE GUN. Sticking out of the back of Ana’s jeans (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She pulls it out. Slips out the cartridge, checks the loa Uses the back of her hand to wipe the beads of sweat off forehead. Blinks. Then SMASHES it back in. INT. HATCH —- ARMORY - DAY 32 SWOOSH. The door slides open. Ana Lucia reaches into her pocket, pulls out her KA-BAR and SLIDES IT ACROSS THE ROO PAN OVER as the KNIFE SKIDS ACROSS THE FLOOR and LANDS AT HENRY’S FEET. He looks up to Ana Lucia questioningly --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Pick it up and cut yourself loose.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Why? Ana Lucia ain’t about to EXPLAIN the situation to him --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You know why. Her tone is dead fucking serious. Henry picks up the knif with his BOUND HANDS. HIS EYES WIDEN with recognition --

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I remember this knife. (beat) The woman you took it from? The woman you murdered. Her name was Jennifer. Ana Lucia looks at him knowing damn well she got that kni off the body of the WOMAN SHE KILLED WITH A ROCK. Henry starts to CUT THROUGH HIS ROPES, shakes his head -- HENRY (CONT’D) He kept saying you were “misunderstood.”

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: What're you talking -- ?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Goodwin. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Henry knows she’s captivated -- milks it for all it’s wor HENRY (CONT’D) Yes. He told us all about you, Ana. He thought you were worthy, that he could change you. (off Ana Lucia) But he was wrong. (goes back to cutting) And it cost him his life.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: (shaken) He... he was gonna kill me. Henry looks up to her, his eyes as innocent as a lamb’s -

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Was he? Ana Lucia blinks. Because she’s asked herself that same question over and over again. But this is not a woman who psychoanalyzes herself. No. She fucking TAKES ACTION.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: You finished? ON HENRY as he lifts up his hands, now free from the rope Opens them in a gesture of surrender.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes, Ana. I’m finished. And now, she reaches around to the back of her jeans. And removes her gun. Holds it at her side. Henry looks at her with a sense of acceptance. Completely FEARLESS. HENRY (CONT’D) So this is it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Yeah, Henry. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We’re in the SYDNEY AIRPORT. And here’s Jack. Wearing the very same SUIT we saw him wearing in the PILOT. He stands at the OCEANIC CUSTOMER SERVICE COUNTER. And he is fucking losing it.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What do you mean you won’t put it on the plane. That’s right, folks. We are back in the scene where Jack screaming at the TICKET AGENT to get his FATHER’S CASKET the PLANE. Jin waits in line behind Jack; SUN in the b.g. deciding whether or not to leave Jin. We stay ON JACK --

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to listen to me, okay? Because I am asking you a favor... (reads her name-tag) “Chrissy?” I am standing in front of you wearing the same suit I’m wearing to my father’s funeral and I’m asking you a favor. And now we PAN the CROWD, the CAMERA SEARCHING, SEARCHING until it LANDS ON -- ANA LUCIA. She’s watching Jack, listening to him. And even though we knew she overheard the conversation, now we get to SEE HE

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I need that coffin to clear customs because there is going to be a hearse waiting there. And that hearse needs to take me and that coffin to the cemetery. Why, Chrissy? Why can’t I just land and bring him to a funeral home and make all the arrangements there? Why can’t I really take my time with it? Because I need it to be done. I need it to be over. And of course, she has nary a fucking idea that the man i that coffin is her friend, “Tom.” But still, Ana Lucia can understand. Her features soften. We see the sympathy in her eyes as she watches Jack. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Ana Lucia pulls out her CELL PHONE and DIALS. S brings the phone to her ear, WE HEAR RINGING ON THE OTHER

dialogues.speaker: ANSWERING MACHINE
dialogues.text: This is Captain Teresa Cortez, please leave a message. Ana Lucia is calling her mother. But she doesn’t leave a message. With a conflicted look o her face, she simply HANGS UP --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack’s at the bar nursing a cocktail. Ana Lucia sits down next to him --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Tequila and tonic with a wedge of lemon. Yes. We’re back in that scene. The scene where Jack and A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucia met for the first time. ONLY THIS TIME -- WE KNOW EVERYTHING. ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) Why were you yelling? ON JACK -- Is she talking to him? ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) The girl at the check-in counter. You were yelling at her. Jack turns, not quite ready for this invasion of privacy

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry -- do I know you? The Woman smiles, undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I’m on your flight. L. A.? (sips her drink; then) So your dad died, huh? AND WE FUCKING CRINGE, because we know even what they do Ana Lucia came to Australia with Christian Shephard and m him in a bar just like she’s meeting Jack. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We also know Ana Lucia now. And as the scene plays out, w recognize that this tough-guy-bravado covers a sad and hu and lonely woman. So we play the scene out in full, becau it’s a different scene, now that we know what lies beneat And she SMILES, actually cracking Jack’s veneer.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, my dad died.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (hesitates; then) Heart attack. Jack lifts his cocktail to his lips, takes a healthy GULP but he makes a FACE as it goes down.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Not a drinker, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (owning it) No. No, not really. She downs the rest of her drink and gives Jack the once o

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what’s your name.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Ana Lucia.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: So tell me, Ana Lucia, why’re you drinking tequila and tonics at ten ‘til noon?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I hate flying. And they stuck me in the back of the plane where the wheels come down right under your damn feet. So where are you sitting? Jack takes out his ticket. Checks it --

dialogues.speaker: 23B.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 42F.
dialogues.text: (smiles) Wanna trade? Jack smiles back -- but before he can answer, her phone RINGS. Ana Lucia checks the caller ID, FLIPS IT OPEN -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) (into phone; ) Hey... Yeah, I’m in Sydney... Hold on. She sups the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA JACK
dialogues.text: Sorry -- k -- Jack. ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) Jack... I gotta talk. We'll have the next drink on the plane, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: 42F, right. She smiles, touches his arm. ON Jack, fully fucking intrigued. And right before she turns away -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) And Jack? Worst part’s over. And now we know that maybe, just maybe, she means that fo herself, too. So Jack smiles and then we go where we’ve never gone before: WE FOLLOW ANA LUCIA OUT OF THE BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, entering the terminal, Ana Lucia’s smile fades and h face fucking falls as she stops, brings the phone to her

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Hi, mom. No, I didn’t leave a message... Yeah, that’s right, Australia. Ana Lucia’s mystery call WAS HER MOTHER. And now, we hear her MOTHER’S VOICE on the other end of the phone -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: Why are you in Australia? No fucking easy answer to that question --

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I don’t know... I... uhm... And now we start to PUSH IN, TIGHTER AND TIGHTER ON ANA L as all of her efforts at holding it together crumble bene the weight of her pain and the sound of her mother’s voic Her mouth quivers, her eyes fill with floods of tears -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) .-.I did something bad... A LONG BEAT, THEN she chokes out -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) ...-You knew... and I got as far away from you as I could, but now... I wanna come home, Mom. It’s a child’s plea for help and her mother hears it. A beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: So come home.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: I’m at the airport right now... I’m on Oceanic Flight 815...

dialogues.speaker: CORTEZ
dialogues.text: I'll be there when you land, querida. ON ANA LUCIA, still crying but now, her face floods with relief, and something altogether new to her... HOPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A GUN. THE gun. And it’s SHAKING. PANNING UP TO FIND IT IN THE HAND OF --— Ana Lucia. She sits on the couch, eyes down. Holds the gu against her thigh. And we see now why it’s shaking -- It’s because SHE'S fucking shaking. And since the last time we saw her was in the armory poin that gun at Henry’s fucking HEAD, we have a good idea why (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where is everybody? Ana Lucia instantly stiffens, turns to see Michael. Wobbl but on his feet. Still looking like hell. Ana becomes sel conscious, tries to play cool. fries.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Whatever you said got ‘em worked up. They went to get all the guns from Sawyer.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (processes this; then) Sawyer. Has all the guns.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Long story. Michael shakes his head. Limps over. Settles down on the couch next to her. Nods to the gun in her hand --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: At least he didn’t get that one.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. (then) Too bad I can’t (fucking) use it. Ana Lucia looks up at Michael... a mixture of anger, vulnerability and SELF-FUCKING-DISGUST.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Use it on what? Ana nods towards the ARMORY DOOR. We see now it is still tightly CLOSED. Yeah. Henry is still ALIVE AND WELL.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: We caught one. One of them. The Others. Got him locked up in there. ON MICHAEL as he turns to look at the door. And SOMETHING his eyes -- maybe DISBELIEF -- or maybe the idea that he THIS close to one of those FUCKERS.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: How long has he -- ? -- Over a week (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: And you're... taking care of him? Feeding him.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've been... I -- (then; looks away) He tried to kill me today. I saw it in his eyes. He wanted me dead. Michael turns back to her. Speechless. Ana takes a breath STRUGGLING with this. Continues -- ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) So I wanted him dead. Because people like that... They -- they should be... And now, the TEARS are starting to come. She hates it. HATES it. But she can’t fucking HELP it, either. ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) He called me a killer... but I can’t... I can’t do it... I can’t even kill him... (losing it) I couldn’t do it -- I... I looked down at him and he... And Ana Lucia looks up at Michael, laid completely bare. this moment. To this relative STRANGER. She just says it ANA LUCIA (CONT’D) I can’t do it anymore. Michael just looks at her. Not without empathy... but the is a HARDNESS here now. Something he brought back with hi from the jungle. A long. Long. BEAT. Then finally --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Then let me do it. Oh. Shit. Fuck. WOW. Ana Lucia BLINKS. Just as surprised as we are. Michael moves closer to her. His OWN eyes watering now --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re animals. I’ve... seen these people and they’re animals. (anger rising) They took my son. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right out of my hands. They took him and they... (stops himself; measured) I’ll do it. Give me the gun and I‘1l kill him. (finally; chilling) Because that’s what they'd do. ON ANA LUCIA. TORN. But knowing Michael is right. And knowing of all the people on the island, no one more than has more REASON to fucking do it. So Michael puts out his hand. And after a long beat -- a long moment of DECISION -- Ana Lucia slowly hands him the fucking gun. Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s the combination?

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: Eighteen to the right. One to the left. Thirty-one to the right. BACK ON MICHAEL -- And his expression changes -- as if he in great EMOTIONAL PAIN that he can’t restrain anymore. A single TEAR slips down his cheek. And then, very, very softly, he says --

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ANA LUCIA
dialogues.text: (confused) For what? Michael abruptly STANDS. Points the gun at Ana Lucia. BLAM. He shoots her. POINT BLANK. And Ana’s eyes barely register surprise as she slides off couch. SLUMPS into a seated position. She looks up at Michael, still pointing the gun at her as opens her mouth -- but it’s not drawn out. No. Because a moment later, her body just... goes SLACK. Her eyes stay open, but the lights are out. Ana Lucia Cortez is dead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (confused) Michael -- ?

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: And Michael is fucking SHOOTING before he even sees what shooting at -- INSTINCT now as he WHIPS AROUND towards th sound of that voice and REVEAL -- LIBBY.

dialogues.speaker: SHOCKED. HOLDING THE BLANKETS SHE WAS GETTING FOR HER PIC
dialogues.text: WITH HURLEY. A BLACKENED HOLE now permeates in the center those blankets as Libby's knees fucking BUCKLE -- She hits the ground like a back of rocks. Over. DONE. Oh sweet fucking CHRIST. TIME STOPS. ON MICHAEL. FREAKING OUT. SWEATING. BLINKING. HIS GUN HAND FUCKING TREMBLING. FROZEN. And then he BREAKS it. Pulls his eyes away from the dead women as he TURNS -- INTENSE -- walks over to the ARMORY GIACCHINO MUSIC starts to POUND now as his SHAKING HAND s the COMBINATION DIAL -- eighteen to the right -- one to t left -- thirty-one to the right. HE PULLS DOWN THE HANDLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DOOR SLIDES OPEN. DARK IN HERE, Michael, the gun at h side, BACKLIT by the living area behind him as we REVEAL. Henry. Sitting in the corner. Untied. And considering he just heard three gunshots and a STRANG MAN is now standing in the doorway of his “cell,” the loo Henry’s face is not one of FEAR... It is one of ACCEPTANCE. He stands up. Faces Michael. And Michael looks at him. ANOTHER tear slides down his fa as he raises the gun... And turns it on HIMSELF -- PUSHING IT AGAINST HIS COLLARB (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO BLACK
dialogues.text: HOLD ON BLACK FOR THREE FULL SECONDS, THEN -——

dialogues.speaker: FADE UP
dialogues.text: EXT. BEACH —- DUSK 38 A static frame. WIDE. Beautiful. Pastoral. It’s a beautiful night. A warm breeze riffles the PALMS. Hurley sits on the sand. The picnic basket. A bottle of WINE next to him. Just holding this frame. Holding on Hurley. Waiting. And although our heart is already aching for him, let’s a the guy one final moment of PEACE... Before it all goes to fucking shit.
